ismatch('"hotel airport"~5', 'Description', 'full', 'any') and Rooms/any(room: not room/SmokingAllowed)    search.ismatch('lux*', 'Description')Next stepsOData geo-spatial functions in Azure AISearch - geo.distance andgeo.intersectsArticle•11/15/2023Azure AI Search supports geo-spatial queries in OData filter expressions via thegeo.distance and geo.intersects functions.
The geo.distance function returns thedistance in kilometers between two points, one being a field or range variable, and onebeing a constant passed as part of the filter. The geo.intersects function returns true ifa given point is within a given polygon, where the point is a field or range variable andthe polygon is specified as a constant passed as part of the filter.
The geo.distance function can also be used in the $orderby parameter to sort searchresults by distance from a given point. The syntax for geo.distance in $orderby is thesame as it is in $filter. When using geo.distance in $orderby, the field to which itapplies must be of type Edm.GeographyPoint and it must also be sortable.
